definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: From this analysis came the concepts value in use and value in exchange.
sentences.chinese: 從這種分析中產生了使用價值和交換價值等概念。

sentences.english: Any possession that has value in an exchange.
sentences.chinese: 任何具有交換價值的佔有物。

sentences.english: Conversely, the exchange value will fall when there is more money.
sentences.chinese: 相反，貨幣供應量增加時，交換價值將下降。

sentences.english: Labour, therefore, is the real measure of the exchangeable value of all commodities.
sentences.chinese: 因此，勞動是衡量一切商品交換價值的真實尺度。

sentences.english: They now assign a much greater exchange value to gold than before.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們給黃金賦予比之前大得多的交換價值。

sentences.english: When the dollar's exchange value increases, so do prices in foreign currencies.
sentences.chinese: 當美元交換價值上升，則以外幣計的價格上升。
